newsitem.title: NORWAY: DnB won't raise bid for BNbank.
newsitem.headline: DnB won't raise bid for BNbank.

text.p: Den norske Bank ASA (DNB), Norway's biggest bank, said on Tuesday it had no plans to raise its bid for takeover target Bolig og Naeringsbanken (BNbank).
"We have announced a competitive bid," DnB spokesman Jarl Veggan said.
DnB on March 21 announced a cash offer valuing BNbank at around 1.90 billion crowns, upping a share exchange bid for BNbank made three days earlier by Fokus Bank.
Fokus, the country's fourth largest bank, subsequently raised its share exchange offer to value BNbank, a mortgage lender, at 2.06 billion crowns.
"Cash has higher quality. We have no plans to come up with a new bid," Veggan said.
Veggan would not comment on an announcement on Tuesday by Fokus it now held 10 percent of share capital of BNbank.
